title: Critics Choice Awards 2025: Complete List of Winners (Updating Live)
description: After two postponements due to the recent Los Angeles wildfires, the 30th annual Critics Choice Awards are being held at last on Friday night. Heading into this year’s ceremony — held live from the Barker Hangar in Santa Monica, and broadcast on E! — FX’s acclaimed drama Shōgun led the TV pack with six total […]
author: Riannucci
excerpt: The 2025 Critics Choice Awards are being handed out Friday night on E! — keep tabs on this year's winners as the ceremony unfolds.
text: After two postponements due to the recent Los Angeles wildfires, the 30th annual Critics Choice Awards are being held at last on Friday night. Heading into this year’s ceremony — held live from the Barker Hangar in Santa Monica, and broadcast on E! — FX’s acclaimed drama Shōgun led the TV pack with six total nominations, followed by Abbott Elementary, Disclaimer, Hacks, The Diplomat, The Penguin and What We Do in the Shadows, all of which scored four nods each. On the film side, papal drama Conclave and musical adaptation Wicked led with 11 nominations apiece, followed closely by Dune: Part Two and the embattled Emilia Pérez, which each garnered 10 nods. Keep scrolling for our up-to-the-minute list of this year’s Critics Choice winners, then drop a comment with your thoughts on the ceremony! html:
After two postponements due to the recent Los Angeles wildfires, the 30th annual Critics Choice Awards are being held at last on Friday night.

Heading into this year’s ceremony — held live from the Barker Hangar in Santa Monica, and broadcast on E! — FX’s acclaimed drama Shōgun led the TV pack with six total nominations, followed by Abbott Elementary, Disclaimer, Hacks, The Diplomat, The Penguin and What We Do in the Shadows, all of which scored four nods each.

On the film side, papal drama Conclave and musical adaptation Wicked led with 11 nominations apiece, followed closely by Dune: Part Two and the embattled Emilia Pérez, which each garnered 10 nods.

Keep scrolling for our up-to-the-minute list of this year’s Critics Choice winners, then drop a comment with your thoughts on the ceremony!

TELEVISION CATEGORIES

BEST DRAMA SERIES
Anne Rice’s Interview With the Vampire
The Day of the Jackal
The Diplomat
Evil
Industry
The Old Man
Shōgun
Slow Horses

BEST ACTOR IN A DRAMA SERIES

Ncuti Gatwa, Doctor Who

Hiroyuki Sanada, Shōgun
